abstract: Invoked when a menu is about to be displayed at the start of a tracking session so the delegate can specify the number of items in the menu.

declaration.code: @MainActor optional func numberOfItems(in menu: NSMenu) -> Int

overview:
## Return Value

The number of menu items in the menu.

## Discussion

If you return a positive value, the menu is resized by either removing or adding items. Newly created items are blank. After the menu is resized, your [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuDelegate/menu(_:update:at:shouldCancel:)] method is called for each item. If you return a negative value, the number of items is left unchanged and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuDelegate/menu(_:update:at:shouldCancel:)] is not called. If you can populate the menu quickly, you can implement [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuDelegate/menuNeedsUpdate(_:)] instead of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuDelegate/numberOfItems(in:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuDelegate/menu(_:update:at:shouldCancel:)].

# numberOfItems(in:)

**Instance Method**

Invoked when a menu is about to be displayed at the start of a tracking session so the delegate can specify the number of items in the menu.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func numberOfItems(in menu: NSMenu) -> Int
```

## Parameters

- **menu**: The menu object about to be displayed.

## Return Value

The number of menu items in the menu.

## Discussion

If you return a positive value, the menu is resized by either removing or adding items. Newly created items are blank. After the menu is resized, your [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuDelegate/menu(_:update:at:shouldCancel:)] method is called for each item. If you return a negative value, the number of items is left unchanged and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuDelegate/menu(_:update:at:shouldCancel:)] is not called. If you can populate the menu quickly, you can implement [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuDelegate/menuNeedsUpdate(_:)] instead of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuDelegate/numberOfItems(in:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSMenuDelegate/menu(_:update:at:shouldCancel:)].

## Handling Tracking

- **menuNeedsUpdate(_:)**: Invoked when a menu is about to be displayed at the start of a tracking session.
